title: How to Make a Chocolate Layered Reeses Peanut Butter Cup Birthday Cake

steps.headline: In a stand or electric mixer, add the cake mix, eggs, oil, water, sour cream, pudding mix and chocolate chips.
steps.description: Beat until well combined, about 1 1/2 minutes. It will be thick.

steps.headline: Pour evenly into well greased cake pans.
steps.description: Bake for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean from center of cakes. Let cool completely.

steps.headline: Prepare the cream cheese frosting.
steps.description: Place softened cream cheese and butter into a mixing bowl, beat on med-high speed until creamy smooth. Slowly beat in powdered sugar until a good spreading consistency forms. It might use almost the entire bag of powdered sugar. Refrigerate for a good hour before frosting.

steps.headline: Turn cakes onto wax paper and with a large serrated knife cut each cake in half width wise to form 4 layers.
steps.description: Place one layer onto a cake stand and drizzle melted peanut butter over top.

steps.headline: Spread a generous amount of cream cheese frosting over that.
steps.description: Place another cake layer on top and repeat peanut butter and frosting until top layer is placed.

steps.headline: Spread remaining frosting over entire cake then top with halved Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Minis.

text: Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  In a stand or electric mixer, add the cake mix, eggs, oil, water, sour cream, pudding mix and chocolate chips. Beat until well combined, about 1 1/2 minutes. It will be thick. Pour evenly into well greased cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean from center of cakes. Let cool completely. Prepare the cream cheese frosting. Place softened cream cheese and butter into a mixing bowl, beat on med-high speed until creamy smooth. Slowly beat in powdered sugar until a good spreading consistency forms. It might use almost the entire bag of powdered sugar. Refrigerate for a good hour before frosting. Turn cakes onto wax paper and with a large serrated knife cut each cake in half width wise to form 4 layers. Place one layer onto a cake stand and drizzle melted peanut butter over top. Spread a generous amount of cream cheese frosting over that. Place another cake layer on top and repeat peanut butter and frosting until top layer is placed. Spread remaining frosting over entire cake then top with halved Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Minis.
